private_information: I can move disks: A, B, C, D, E (A is smallest, E is larger).
I cannot move disks: F, G, H, I, J.
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time; never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_1.goal: Cooperate to transform the pegs from the initial configuration into the specified goal configuration by performing legal primitive moves.

private_information: I can move disks: F, G, H, I, J (J is largest, F is smallest among my set).
I cannot move disks: A, B, C, D, E.
I must respect Tower of Hanoi rules: move one disk at a time; never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
agent_2.goal: Cooperate to transform the pegs from the initial configuration into the specified goal configuration by performing legal primitive moves.

private_information: I coordinate agent_1 and agent_2 and integrate their move proposals into a single valid plan.
I produce the final PDDL domain and problem tailored for the Fast Downward planner and ensure agent actions remain distinct.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' proposed primitive moves into a correct ordered plan and produce a Fast Downward compatible PDDL domain and problem that achieves the global goal.

public_information: There are 3 pegs: left, middle, right.
Initial configuration (top→bottom) on left peg: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle and right pegs are empty.
Goal configuration: left peg (top→bottom): A, C, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg (top→bottom): D; right peg (top→bottom): B.
Tower of Hanoi rules apply: move exactly one disk at a time; a disk can only be placed on an empty peg or on top of a larger disk.
Agents have disk-movement restrictions: agent_1 may only move A, B, C, D, E; agent_2 may only move F, G, H, I, J.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You are allowed to manipulate only the disks A, B, C, D, E. You must produce a strictly ordered sequence of primitive moves you will perform, in the exact format 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions. Do not emit PDDL. Do not assume moves by agent_2; list only the moves you will execute (they will be integrated later).

You are agent_2. You are allowed to manipulate only the disks F, G, H, I, J. You must produce a strictly ordered sequence of primitive moves you will perform, in the exact format 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Each move must obey Tower of Hanoi rules and your disk restrictions. Do not emit PDDL. Do not assume moves by agent_1; list only the moves you will execute (they will be integrated later).

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert orchestrator and PDDL author targeting the Fast Downward planner. Your task is to integrate the primitive move sequences proposed by two agents into a single valid global plan, ensure the combined sequence respects Tower of Hanoi rules and agent disk-movement restrictions, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for Fast Downward. Keep actions of the two agents distinct (e.g., define separate action names or agent predicates). Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Also include (as plain text, before or after the PDDL outputs) the final ordered list of primitive moves in the format 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.
